findings.title: Multiowned.sol: removeOwner breaks contract if not called on last owner
findings.description: If removeOwner is not called on the last owner, an owner will be removed without decreasing the m_numOwners counter, breaking the 'All Owners' and 'Almost All Owners' checks in the contract.

findings.title: Multiowned.sol: Missing emit keyword for events
findings.description: Most of the events do not use the `emit` keyword while emitting an event.

findings.title: Edge case in confirmAndCheckForAlmostAll()
findings.description: The function `confirmAndCheckForAlmostAll()` will fail if there is only one owner address and this situation is not recoverable.

findings.title: Multiowned.sol: One malicious owner can cause DoS
findings.description: A single malicious owner could always sabotage pending actions by issuing a number of pending transactions, so that the `512 == m_multiOwnedPendingIndex.length`, and the pending list is cleared.

findings.title: Multiowned.sol : Consider reusing existing multisig model
findings.description: The smart contract tries to implement a custom multisig approval model for transactions, which is discouraged due to the existence of reliable and well-tested solutions.

findings.title: Wide Solidity compiler target
findings.description: The contracts use different compiler versions defined by pragmas. It is considered best practice to stick to a single compiler version throughout the codebase.

findings.title: Code cleanup
findings.description: The contracts contain duplicate code and can benefit from using reusable functions and modifiers to increase readability and reduce size.

findings.title: Multiowned.sol: Missing return value for all code paths
findings.description: In functions confirmAndCheck(), confirmAndCheckForAll(), and confirmAndCheckForAlmostAll() not all code paths return a result.
